result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin W McCormick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristin W McCormick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristin W McCormick was found guilty of Credit Fraud-Furnish/Goods (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(6)(a).
  • Kristin W McCormick was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. W/H adjudication on ct 1. Ct 1 will be dismissed upon completion of prob on cts 2 & 3.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Not to work in a job that handles money, credit cards or checks except present job and after employer is informed of charge.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lululemon.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.
